title: Rito loves Counterplay
body:
Ever had to lane as {{champion:48}} top against {{champion:429}} ?

Maybe the worst experience ever.

replies.body: oh lord... I'm sorry for your loss ;_;

That was like two weeks ago so I'm not upset with it anymore.

However, it was horrible in that no matter what I did she had every advantage. My pillar? Hop hop hop... 

"just wait for ganks!" Yes, because that's what I want to do, get no creep and sit under my tower waiting for my jungler who may or may not suck anyway to come top and lose valuable objectives like Dragon.

If Riot is all about there being counterplay and no true hard counters than they've way overlooked this.lol

Riot only considered champion-champion interactions **based on expected lane-match-up or roles**.

They never considered interaction outside of bot lane vs. bot lane, top lane vs. top lane, etc...so if champions from one lane goes into another Riot is suddenly as a loss for options...
That makes Riot sound pretty ignorant of their own game...

Well from my observations, every time someone from one lane goes to another, especially ranged with some distinct advantage that counter melee initiation (Quinn vs. Gapcloser Bruiser, for example), the laning phase becomes ridiculously difficult for the melee, which isn't particularly supposed to happen. 

I think Riot is expecting jungle presence to make up for that difference in lane presence...but overall, I feel that champions are balanced based on how well they fare against expected matchups, not based on their position in the global champion pool OR  champion-item interactions.

I never really thought about this. Goes to show how much Riot is pushing meta building in the end of it all. And the real issue with this is that this kind of match up doesn't work the other way around in most cases. {{champion:48}} versus {{champion:429}}, Kalista wins. No matter what lane you go to. So essentially as the mobility creep worsens, it will make champions like Trundle weak just because they exist, not because Trundle himself is weak (which in reality he isn't at all).

Kinda inaccurate. Trundle is worse then ranged top laners because he isn't ranged yes. However kalista hasn't added to that problem and even if she sees play top won't make trundle any worse then he already is. The game is so saturated with mobility that trundle can have a hard time regardless of what ranged top laner fights him.

With Kalista top I wonder what the rest of the team comp was. In my experience as a Garen player I see this mismatch quite often because there is no concept of teamwork in the mtches I am in. Players are tired of trying to play jungle or support in this environment dominated by toxic ADCs. Against Kalista top I have had no problems winning the match with a proper team on my side that can work together. Yes it is horrible and discouraging to spend the early game hiding under turret, but the oppsoing team suffers in the end trying to survive without a tanky top champion.

I do agree the mobility creep is dangerous with champions like gnar, but the frustration seeing Kalista top is in my opinion a low ELO symptom of how difficult players find the jungle and support roles inder the shadow of high burst damage and high mobility champions.

Tanky top champions (unless they're some mao-esque tank with tons of cc and a huge defensive steriod) aren't even good lategame let alone important. They get shredded by adcs and can't do as much in a teamfight as ranged aps.

Basically the role of fighters right now is to suck horribly in lane, be good for a few midgame teamfights where the opposing adc hasn't bought last whisper and started laughing at you yet, then suck again.

It could be a lane swap like what you see in competitive play.  Where the ADC takes the solo lane and the support roams/leeches off of everyone until late laning phase.  The other side lane would have their top laner faced off against the opposing team's ADC.

Lane swaps are why you don't see Trundle in the LCS anymore, because unlike Lissandra/Maokai/Irelia he's completely ouclassed in a 1v2 or when facing a 1v1 vs ranged.

Edit:

I do believe that Kalista's passive is too strong, but only during the mid-game and team fights.  A rival ADC can smoke Kalista if they end up in a duel but that condition doesn't happen because they spend their post 10-minute spikes chewing up enemy assassins/tanks and doing cleanup.  Kalista is pretty bad at seiging towers, but awesome at putting baron/dragon on lock.

not necessarily, {{champion:67}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:43}}  were signaled to be viable top lane on release ( not sure about vayne, but definitely karma and liss. )

Playing against them toplane ( someone who plays them correctly, mind you. )

Is one of the worst experiences in life as a whole, provided this is a fucking video game where you're supposed to have fun.

Nah. Ranged tops have been there for ages and have always been a pain in the ass, and post doran's shield gutting have always been straight up broken. Riot just refuses to balance ranged vs melee laning. It's not some general "some champions going to other lanes might be imbalanced". It's specifically ranged champions going to the lane where people try to play melees.

>Riot just refuses to balance ranged vs melee laning

But that's exactly what I'm saying. 

Top champions are balanced based on the interaction of champions by expected match-ups. Ryze was fine as a mid champion but the moment he became a top laner in the meta he "needed" nerfs, because Riot never considered how **ranged champions can crush top lane meta, a place where Riot intended melee bruisers to be, until the ranged champions started going top**.

Same thing with Kalista. In the ADC/Support bot lane meta, she is more or less bearable: there's no one that she can hilariously kite because ADC/supports either have ranged attacks/poke or have good duration CC. However at top, no bruiser can trade properly with Kalista (unless your name is Jax and you are above level 6) because they are intended to deal damage over time but Kalista denies champions that can fight but has no way to stick (with roots/stuns).

My point was it's specifically a top lane problem when you made it sound more general. Take an adc mid and they'll be strong but not necessarily broken. Take a double mage kill lane bot and it might be ok but definitely not broken. Other classes don't have the massive balance problem being incapable of dealing with champions from other lanes, just fighters.

You see the problem is there is no possible way for Trundle to ever actually defeat Kalista. Trundle is melee and has no hard CC, nor does he have outlandish enough mobility to keep up. Meaning there is nothing he can do about Kalista kiting him to oblivion. Xerath can defeat Zed if played properly that **IS A POSSIBILITY**. Trundle defeating Kalista **IS NOT**. See the difference? In one of these you will probably lose, in the other you will **ALWAYS** lose.

This is why Riot has already stated they are working on nerfing or changing Kalista's passive. It doesn't just give her little counterplay, it gives her NO counterplay at all against certain champions like {{champion:48}} {{champion:86}} etc.

Don't rework my Trundle please!  I prefer the low mobility fighter, rather than having a "new improved" skill shot on 3 abilities...

I honestly prefer they leave some of my old favorites alone..
Trundle,Taric, Mao, Nasus..  

I don't enjoy hopping around and flinging skill shots everywhere... but I'm not a twitch finger plat 1 player by any means.. Mao is the closest thing to a skill shot champion I enjoy..

I figure soon, my play style will be gone - but for now i'm still holding on!

I wouldn't want him reworked either. I happen to like immobile melee champs, and Garen happens to be my favorite champion to this day. Of course i also  happen to like twitch oriented skillshot types. To bad Kalista makes both of those style of champions pretty useless.

I only main Garen and still enjoy playing when I can survive past level 12 without either team surrendering. Yes the early game has become a nightmare this season but mostly due to how hard the jungle and support role can be at the level I play. I love the fact that I can still play Garen and have fun and fear changes that would require more keyboard dexterity. How about fixing the jungle so I can get some teamwork there.

Yeah the entire mobility creep has screwed over most top lanes with the exception of super tanks like Maokai and Mundo. It seems like everyone else such as {{champion:48}}  and {{champion:102}} can rot for all that riot cares.
